results.title: The World: A Television History. Ep. 01. Human Origins
results.creator_credit: Taylor Downing, Bricomin Films, Channel Four, Goldcrest TV and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The World: A Television History”.
This episode looks at the origins of mankind; where we come from, and how we differ from other forms of life on earth. It traces our descent from apes in trees, to land apes who stood erect, to our large brain development 500,000 years ago. Since that time no brain development has occurred, only changes in appearance to suit the different climates that existed after the ice-age. 10,000 years ago humans reached a social and cultural level which put them far above other animal life. Based on The Times atlas of world history.

results.title: 3,000 Years of Conflict
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
Breathtaking in scope,”3,000 Years of Conflict” traces India’s turbulent history from the Aryan invaders in 1500 BC to Independence in 1947.

results.title: Hidden India
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a complex country of multiple languages, lifestyles, religions and cultures which are thousands of years old, a country of hidden wonders which the average tourist never sees. This documentary explores many of these wonders and vividly recounts, even dramatically reconstructs some of India’s intriguing stories.

results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a land of contradictions. Mrs. Ghandi discusses in an in-depth yet light-hearted and often amusing interview, India’s contemporary and greatly diversified lifestyles.

results.title: In the name of love
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
It has only been in the past decade or so that many Indian women have taken a definite step towards “Liberation” but despite the fact that a few women have played major roles in government these ladies are few in number, considering the population. The majority are still treated as inferiors, and appear to be completely self-effacing. This modern day ‘modesty’ seems an anachronism considering the role love and equality have played in the history and culture of this exotic land. This film explores the folklore and mythology of love in India.

results.title: Might, majesty and mysticism
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is synonymous with mysticism and this film goes on to explore the many incredible facets of this way of life - and death. Many people from around the world are flocking to India, not as tourists, not to see the might and majesty (of breathtaking architecture that is)… They come to find themselves through the teachings of the gurus, the powerful holy men. Might and majesty in the guise of mysticism has returned to India.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions

results.title: Stories in stone
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
Mark Twain described India as, “the one land that all men desire to see and having seen once, even a glimpse, would not give that glimpse for all the shows of the rest of the globe combined”. This video explores many of the familiar and not so familiar monuments of hidden India. They range from massive carvings to mind-boggling man made temples.

results.title: Invocation of My Demon Brother; Lucifer Rising
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Anger and Puck Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Anger Magick Lantern Cycle”.
Invocation of my demon brother (1969, 11 min) A conjuration of pagan forces comes off the screen in a surge of spiritual and mystical power. The shadowing forth of Lord Lucifer, as the powers gather at a midnight mass. Lucifer Rising (1970-80, 28 min) - A film about the love generation- the birthday party of the Aquarian age showing actual ceremonies to make Lucifer rise. Lucifer is the light god, not the devil- the rebel angel behind what’s happening in the world today. His message is that the key of joy is disobedience. Isis wakes. Osiris answers. Lilith climbs to the place of Sacrifice. The Magus activates the circle and Lucifer, bringer of light, breaks through.
